Title: Help Topics
Description: This serves as the guide for users on how to use the Winter Text Editor
Instructions: Select the topic you want to read from the tree at the left.

Topics.Title: File
Topics.Description: This section will teach you how to create, open, and save changes to files or directories, and more
Instructions: In order to read the sub-sections, just click any of the topics under this one from the topics tree at the left.
You can also just click on any of the links below.

Topics.Title: Creating a new file
Instructions: Go to File Menu > New File. A new tab will be opened.
Alternatively, you can do Ctrl+N (Control and N key together).

Topics.Title: Opening a new file
Instructions: Go to File Menu > Open File. A file chooser dialog will appear.
Select the file you want to open using the file chooser dialog. The file will be opened on a new tab
Alternatively, you can do Ctrl+O.

Topics.Title: Opening a directory
Instructions: Go to File Menu > Open Directory. A file chooser dialog will appear.
Select the directory you want to open using the file chooser dialog. The directory tree will be added to the project trees at the left.
Alternatively, you can do Ctrl+Shift+O.

Topics.Title: Save
Instructions: Go to File Menu > Save.
Alternatively, you can do Ctrl+S.
If the file hasn't been saved yet, a Save As dialog box will appear allowing you to provide a name this file before saving it.

Topics.Title: Save As
Instructions: Go to File Menu > Save As.
Alternatively, you can do Ctrl+Shift+S.
A Save As dialog box will appear, allowing you to provide a name this file before saving it.

Topics.Title: Restart
Instructions: Go to File Menu > Restart. This closes the application.
Wait for Winter to start again.

Topics.Title: Exit
Instructions: Go to File Menu > Exit.
Alternatively, you can do Ctrl+Q.

Topics.Title: Edit
Topics.Description:
Most of the time, you are going to edit files (that's what text editors are for). 
Winter supports the most common file-editing actions like Undo, Find, Copy and others.

Topics.Title: Undo changes to a file
Instructions: Edit > Undo. Alternatively, you can type Ctrl+Z. You can also right click on the editor area and select Undo.

Topics.Title: Redo changes to a file
Instructions: Edit > Redo. Alternatively, you can type Ctrl+Y. You can also right click on the editor area and select Redo.

Topics.Title: Find Text
Instructions: Edit > Find. Alternatively, you can type Ctrl+F. You can also right click on the editor area and select Find.
A panel will appear below the editor area. You can then type the text to find in the text field.
Click the up or down arrow to search in a specific direction.
Click the hide botton at the upper right side of the Find Panel to hide it.

Topics.Title: Replace Text
Instructions: Edit > Replace. Alternatively, you can type Ctrl+R. You can also right click on the editor area and select Replace.
A panel will appear below the editor area. You can then type the text to find in the first text field.
Click the up or down arrow to search in a specific direction.
Type the new text (replacement text) in the second text field.
You can choose whether to replace the currently selected matched text or all of them. Just choose between Replace and Replace All buttons.
Click the hide botton at the upper right side of the Find Panel to hide it.

Topics.Title: Copy Text to Clipboard
Instructions: Edit > Copy. Alternatively, you can type Ctrl+Z. You can also right click on the editor area and select Copy.

Topics.Title: Cut Text to Clipboard
Instructions: Edit > Undo. Alternatively, you can type Ctrl+Z. You can also right click on the editor area and select Cut

Topics.Title: Paste Text from Clipboard
Instructions: Edit > Paste. Alternatively, you can type Ctrl+Z. You can also right click on the editor area and select undo.

Topics.Title: View
Topics.Description:
You can hide or show some of the parts of the Winter Text Editor. For now, the only way to do it is to use the View Menu. 
The next sub-sections will show how to hide/view the specific pnaels. 
The instruction to show is the same as the one for hiding.

Topics.Title: Show/Hide Line Numbers
Topics.Description: Some programmers prefer to hide the line numbers, located at the left side of the editor.
Instructions: View > Line Numbers

Topics.Title: Show/Hide Projects
Instructions: View > Projects

Topics.Title: Show/Hide Toolbar
Instructions: View > Toolbar

Topics.Title: Navigation
Topics.Description:
The Navigation Menu contains the options on how to perform navigations. 
Currently, the supported fetures are Go To File and Go To Line.

Topics.Title: Go to File
Topics.Description:
This feature allows you to go from one file to another. 
Note: You can only apply this to opened files.
Instructions: Navigation > Go to File. A dialog box will appear with a text field, and a list of opened files to below it.
Type the name of the file you want to go to in the text field. Notice that the list changes as you type (it's auto-completion).
Press Enter key.

Topics.Title: Go to Line
Topics.Description: This will bring the cursor to the specific line specified by the user.
Instructions: Navigation > Go to Line. A dialog box will appear with a text field, asking you to input the line number.
Type the line number you want to go to.
Press the Enter key.
